alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FUNNEL CLOUDS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 248 PM MDT, Storm spotters were tracking a shower producing a tropical funnel cloud between Chama and Dulce, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tropical funnel clouds. SOURCE...Spotter indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible, though confidence is low that the funnel cloud will reach the ground. Locations impacted include... Dulce, Lumberton and Monero. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 130 and 151. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Localized gusty winds to 55 mph are possible in the vicinity of these funnel clouds. Localized damage to lightweight structures such as outbuildings, carports and patio covers, as well as tree branches and street signs, is possible.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
